nodes.bodyText: I think this test comes from the archetype. We should remove or implement it :)

Just general consideration, we should think about a way to "automatically" refresh these type of files that contain the output of the generation.
Wdyt?
Of course it is not something to be done in this ticket :)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,213 @@
+package sample_score

nodes.bodyText:
@danielezonca
I'm not sure. On one side it could be useful to find out different behavior between "drl" and executable model execution. But on the other side they help me when I do some changes on the factories - to compare the "working" (previous) version with the (eventually broken) new one; and this latter is the reason why I'm keeping them
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,213 @@
+package sample_score

nodes.bodyText:
?
I think we should implement this method :)

@danielezonca
TBH I think not. This evaluate is here because it is inherited from (grand)parent, but for drools-related models it is unused (evaluation is done differently) and with the current design it is correct that it throws the exception.
What it should be done (in future ticket) it is to re-design the KiePMMLModel hierarchy to be more consistent.
But at the same time this is strongly related to https://issues.redhat.com/browse/DROOLS-5258
Just a "codestyle" comment. You can use TYPE field in boxed classes to get primitive class of it (i.e. Boolean.TYPE instead of boolean.class)

nodes.bodyText: Would it be possible to add some warning to this switch? Something which warns about unexpected value. Or can we remove this default?
I would suggest to use "KiePMMLDroolsModel.class" without getName. I think that it wills add also package name to log output.
Can you please split this line earlier. It still creates long lines which decrease readability.
Can you please split this line earlier. It still creates long lines which decrease readability.
Can you please split this line earlier. It still creates long lines which decrease readability.
Can we use some kind of dependency management here instead of property values?

nodes.bodyText:
@jiripetrlik
For the moment being I put all those GAVs inside dependencyManagement tag. Sooner or later they could be moved in parent BOM, but I'm not sure if it has much sense; anyway, I would like to do that later, in one single-repo PR

nodes.bodyText: What about an enum instead of a string for operator? Is it possible to have custom operators?

@danielezonca
Refactored for both KiePMMLFieldOperatorValue and KiePMMLOperatorValue
Please rename as droolsModel or droolsPMMLModel for consistency
Can you split this signature in multiple lines for readability?
Can you please wrap this call with an if statement and add it only if the log level is debug?
